verses.verse: לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ׀ <S%H5329><s%> lam-natz-Tze-acho the chief Musician עַֽל־ <S%H5921><s%> [T'al-upon נְגִינַ֬ת <S%H5058><s%> ne-gi-Nat upon Neginah לְדָוִֽד׃ <S%H1732><s%> le-da-Vid. [A Psalm] of David שִׁמְעָ֣ה <S%H8085><s%> shim-'Ah Hear אֱ֭לֹהִים <S%H430><s%> E-lo-Him O God רִנָּתִ֑י <S%H7440><s%> rin-na-Ti; my cry הַ֝קְשִׁ֗יבָה <S%H7181><s%> hak-Shi-vah, attend תְּפִלָּתִֽי׃ <S%H8605><s%> te-fil-la-Ti. unto my prayer

מִקְצֵ֤ה <S%H7097><s%> mik-Tzeh From the end הָאָ֨רֶץ׀ <S%H776><s%> ha-'A-retz of the earth אֵלֶ֣יךָ <S%H413><s%> 'e-Lei-cha about אֶ֭קְרָא <S%H7121><s%> 'Ek-ra will I cry בַּעֲטֹ֣ף <S%H5848><s%> ba-'a-Tof is overwhelmed לִבִּ֑י <S%H3820><s%> lib-Bi; unto thee when my heart בְּצוּר־ <S%H6697><s%> be-tzur- me to the rock יָר֖וּם <S%H7311><s%> ya-Rum [that] is higher מִמֶּ֣נִּי <S%H4480><s%> mi-Men-ni than תַנְחֵֽנִי׃ <S%H5148><s%> tan-Che-ni. lead

כִּֽי־ <S%H3588><s%> ki- for הָיִ֣יתָ <S%H1961><s%> ha-Yi-ta have been מַחְסֶ֣ה <S%H4268><s%> mach-Seh For thou hast been a shelter לִ֑י Li; מִגְדַּל־ <S%H4026><s%> mig-dal- tower עֹ֝֗ז <S%H5797><s%> 'Oz, for me [and] a strong מִפְּנֵ֥י <S%H6440><s%> mip-pe-Nei from אוֹיֵֽב׃ <S%H341><s%> o-Yev. the enemy

אָג֣וּרָה <S%H1481><s%> 'a-Gu-rah I will abide בְ֭אָהָלְךָ <S%H168><s%> Ve-'a-hal-cha in thy tabernacle עוֹלָמִ֑ים <S%H5769><s%> o-la-Mim; for ever אֶֽחֱסֶ֨ה <S%H2620><s%> 'e-che-Seh I will trust בְסֵ֖תֶר <S%H5643><s%> ve-Se-ter in the covert כְּנָפֶ֣יךָ <S%H3671><s%> ke-na-Fei-cha of thy wings סֶּֽלָה׃ <S%H5542><s%> Se-lah. Selah

כִּֽי־ <S%H3588><s%> ki- for אַתָּ֣ה <S%H859><s%> 'at-Tah O אֱ֭לֹהִים <S%H430><s%> E-lo-Him For thou O God שָׁמַ֣עְתָּ <S%H8085><s%> sha-Ma'-ta hast heard לִנְדָרָ֑י <S%H5088><s%> lin-da-Rai; my vows נָתַ֥תָּ <S%H5414><s%> na-Ta-ta thou hast given יְ֝רֻשַּׁ֗ת <S%H3425><s%> ye-rush-Shat, [me] the heritage יִרְאֵ֥י <S%H3373><s%> yir-'Ei of those that fear שְׁמֶֽךָ׃ <S%H8034><s%> she-Me-cha. thy name

יָמִ֣ים <S%H3117><s%> ya-Mim life עַל־ <S%H5921><s%> 'al- and יְמֵי־ <S%H3117><s%> ye-mei- life מֶ֣לֶךְ <S%H4428><s%> Me-lech the king's תּוֹסִ֑יף <S%H3254><s%> to-Sif; Thou wilt prolong שְׁ֝נוֹתָ֗יו <S%H8141><s%> no-Tav, [and] his years כְּמוֹ־ <S%H3644><s%> ke-mov- will be as דֹ֥ר <S%H1755><s%> dor as many וָדֹֽר׃ <S%H1755><s%> va-Dor. generations

יֵשֵׁ֣ב <S%H3427><s%> ye-Shev He shall abide ע֭וֹלָם <S%H5769><s%> o-lom for ever לִפְנֵ֣י <S%H6440><s%> lif-Nei before אֱלֹהִ֑ים <S%H430><s%> E-lo-Him; God חֶ֥סֶד <S%H2617><s%> Che-sed mercy וֶ֝אֱמֶ֗ת <S%H571><s%> ve-'e-Met, and truth מַ֣ן <S%H4487><s%> man O prepare יִנְצְרֻֽהוּ׃ <S%H5341><s%> yin-tze-Ru-hu. [which] may preserve

כֵּ֤ן <S%H3651><s%> ken So אֲזַמְּרָ֣ה <S%H2167><s%> 'a-zam-me-Rah So will I sing שִׁמְךָ֣ <S%H8034><s%> shim-Cha praise unto thy name לָעַ֑ד <S%H5703><s%> la-'Ad; for ever לְֽשַׁלְּמִ֥י <S%H7999><s%> le-shal-le-Mi perform נְדָרַ֗י <S%H5088><s%> ne-da-Rai, my vows י֣וֹם׀ <S%H3117><s%> Yom day יֽוֹם׃ <S%H3117><s%> Yom. day
